2592megasas_build_syspd_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
2593 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd, struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd,
2594 bool fp_possible)
2595{
2596 u32 device_id;
2597 struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST *io_request;
2598 u16 pd_index = 0;
2599 u16 os_timeout_value;
2600 u16 timeout_limit;
2601 struct MR_DRV_RAID_MAP_ALL *local_map_ptr;
2602 struct RAID_CONTEXT *pRAID_Context;
2603 struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ_NUM_SYNC *pd_sync;
2604 struct MR_PRIV_DEVICE *mr_device_priv_data;
2605 struct fusion_context *fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
2606 pd_sync = (void *)fusion->pd_seq_sync[(instance->pd_seq_map_id - 1) & 1];
2607
2608 device_id = MEGASAS_DEV_INDEX(scmd);
2609 pd_index = MEGASAS_PD_INDEX(scmd);
2610 os_timeout_value = scmd->request->timeout / HZ;
2611 mr_device_priv_data = scmd->device->hostdata;
2612 cmd->pd_interface = mr_device_priv_data->interface_type;
2613
2614 io_request = cmd->io_request;
2615 /* get RAID_Context pointer */
2616 pRAID_Context = &io_request->RaidContext.raid_context;
2617 pRAID_Context->reg_lock_flags = 0;
2618 pRAID_Context->reg_lock_row_lba = 0;
2619 pRAID_Context->reg_lock_length = 0;
2620 io_request->DataLength = cpu_to_le32(scsi_bufflen(scmd));
2621 io_request->LUN[1] = scmd->device->lun;
2622 pRAID_Context->raid_flags = MR_RAID_FLAGS_IO_SUB_TYPE_SYSTEM_PD
2623 << MR_RAID_CTX_RAID_FLAGS_IO_SUB_TYPE_SHIFT;
2624
2625 /* If FW supports PD sequence number */
2626 if (instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp &&
2627 instance->pd_list[pd_index].driveType == TYPE_DISK) {
2628 /* TgtId must be incremented by 255 as jbod seq number is index
2629 * below raid map
2630 */
2631 /* More than 256 PD/JBOD support for Ventura */
2632 if (instance->support_morethan256jbod)
2633 pRAID_Context->virtual_disk_tgt_id =
2634 pd_sync->seq[pd_index].pd_target_id;
2635 else
2636 pRAID_Context->virtual_disk_tgt_id =
2637 cpu_to_le16(device_id + (MAX_PHYSICAL_DEVICES - 1));
2638 pRAID_Context->config_seq_num = pd_sync->seq[pd_index].seqNum;
2639 io_request->DevHandle = pd_sync->seq[pd_index].devHandle;
2640 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
2641 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.routing_flags |=
2642 (1 << MR_RAID_CTX_ROUTINGFLAGS_SQN_SHIFT);
2643 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.nseg_type |=
2644 (1 << RAID_CONTEXT_NSEG_SHIFT);
2645 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.nseg_type |=
2646 (MPI2_TYPE_CUDA << RAID_CONTEXT_TYPE_SHIFT);
2647 } else {
2648 pRAID_Context->type = MPI2_TYPE_CUDA;
2649 pRAID_Context->nseg = 0x1;
2650 pRAID_Context->reg_lock_flags |=
2651 (MR_RL_FLAGS_SEQ_NUM_ENABLE|MR_RL_FLAGS_GRANT_DESTINATION_CUDA);
2652 }
2653 } else if (fusion->fast_path_io) {
2654 pRAID_Context->virtual_disk_tgt_id = cpu_to_le16(device_id);
2655 pRAID_Context->config_seq_num = 0;
2656 local_map_ptr = fusion->ld_drv_map[(instance->map_id & 1)];
2657 io_request->DevHandle =
2658 local_map_ptr->raidMap.devHndlInfo[device_id].curDevHdl;
2659 } else {
2660 /* Want to send all IO via FW path */
2661 pRAID_Context->virtual_disk_tgt_id = cpu_to_le16(device_id);
2662 pRAID_Context->config_seq_num = 0;
2663 io_request->DevHandle = cpu_to_le16(0xFFFF);
2664 }
2665
2666 cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.DevHandle = io_request->DevHandle;
2667
2668 cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.MSIxIndex =
2669 instance->reply_map[raw_smp_processor_id()];
2670
2671 if (!fp_possible) {
2672 /* system pd firmware path */
2673 io_request->Function = MEGASAS_MPI2_FUNCTION_LD_IO_REQUEST;
2674 cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.RequestFlags =
2675 (MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_SCSI_IO <<
2676 MEGASAS_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_SHIFT);
2677 pRAID_Context->timeout_value = cpu_to_le16(os_timeout_value);
2678 pRAID_Context->virtual_disk_tgt_id = cpu_to_le16(device_id);
2679 } else {
2680 /* system pd Fast Path */
2681 io_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_SCSI_IO_REQUEST;
2682 timeout_limit = (scmd->device->type == TYPE_DISK) ?
2683 255 : 0xFFFF;
2684 pRAID_Context->timeout_value =
2685 cpu_to_le16((os_timeout_value > timeout_limit) ?
2686 timeout_limit : os_timeout_value);
2687 if (instance->adapter_type >= INVADER_SERIES)
2688 io_request->IoFlags |=
2689 cpu_to_le16(MPI25_SAS_DEVICE0_FLAGS_ENABLED_FAST_PATH);
2690
2691 cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.RequestFlags =
2692 (MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_FP_IO <<
2693 MEGASAS_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_SHIFT);
2694 }
2695}
2696
2697/**
2698 * megasas_build_io_fusion - Prepares IOs to devices
2699 * @instance: Adapter soft state
2700 * @scp: SCSI command
2701 * @cmd: Command to be prepared
2702 *
2703 * Invokes helper functions to prepare request frames
2704 * and sets flags appropriate for IO/Non-IO cmd
2705 */
2706int
2707megasas_build_io_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
2708 struct scsi_cmnd *scp,
2709 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd)
2710{
2711 int sge_count;
2712 u8 cmd_type;
2713 struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST *io_request = cmd->io_request;
2714 struct MR_PRIV_DEVICE *mr_device_priv_data;
2715 mr_device_priv_data = scp->device->hostdata;
2716
2717 /* Zero out some fields so they don't get reused */
2718 memset(io_request->LUN, 0x0, 8);
2719 io_request->CDB.EEDP32.PrimaryReferenceTag = 0;
2720 io_request->CDB.EEDP32.PrimaryApplicationTagMask = 0;
2721 io_request->EEDPFlags = 0;
2722 io_request->Control = 0;
2723 io_request->EEDPBlockSize = 0;
2724 io_request->ChainOffset = 0;
2725 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context.raid_flags = 0;
2726 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context.type = 0;
2727 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context.nseg = 0;
2728
2729 memcpy(io_request->CDB.CDB32, scp->cmnd, scp->cmd_len);
2730 /*
2731 * Just the CDB length,rest of the Flags are zero
2732 * This will be modified for FP in build_ldio_fusion
2733 */
2734 io_request->IoFlags = cpu_to_le16(scp->cmd_len);
2735
2736 switch (cmd_type = megasas_cmd_type(scp)) {
2737 case READ_WRITE_LDIO:
2738 megasas_build_ldio_fusion(instance, scp, cmd);
2739 break;
2740 case NON_READ_WRITE_LDIO:
2741 megasas_build_ld_nonrw_fusion(instance, scp, cmd);
2742 break;
2743 case READ_WRITE_SYSPDIO:
2744 megasas_build_syspd_fusion(instance, scp, cmd, true);
2745 break;
2746 case NON_READ_WRITE_SYSPDIO:
2747 if (instance->secure_jbod_support ||
2748 mr_device_priv_data->is_tm_capable)
2749 megasas_build_syspd_fusion(instance, scp, cmd, false);
2750 else
2751 megasas_build_syspd_fusion(instance, scp, cmd, true);
2752 break;
2753 default:
2754 break;
2755 }
2756
2757 /*
2758 * Construct SGL
2759 */
2760
2761 sge_count = megasas_make_sgl(instance, scp, cmd);
2762
2763 if (sge_count > instance->max_num_sge || (sge_count < 0)) {
2764 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
2765 "%s %d sge_count (%d) is out of range. Range is: 0-%d\n",
2766 __func__, __LINE__, sge_count, instance->max_num_sge);
2767 return 1;
2768 }
2769
2770 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
2771 set_num_sge(&io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35, sge_count);
2772 cpu_to_le16s(&io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.routing_flags);
2773 cpu_to_le16s(&io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.nseg_type);
2774 } else {
2775 /* numSGE store lower 8 bit of sge_count.
2776 * numSGEExt store higher 8 bit of sge_count
2777 */
2778 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context.num_sge = sge_count;
2779 io_request->RaidContext.raid_context.num_sge_ext =
2780 (u8)(sge_count >> 8);
2781 }
2782
2783 io_request->SGLFlags = cpu_to_le16(MPI2_SGE_FLAGS_64_BIT_ADDRESSING);
2784
2785 if (scp->sc_data_direction == PCI_DMA_TODEVICE)
2786 io_request->Control |= cpu_to_le32(MPI2_SCSIIO_CONTROL_WRITE);
2787 else if (scp->sc_data_direction == PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE)
2788 io_request->Control |= cpu_to_le32(MPI2_SCSIIO_CONTROL_READ);
2789
2790 io_request->SGLOffset0 =
2791 offsetof(struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST, SGL) / 4;
2792
2793 io_request->SenseBufferLowAddress = cpu_to_le32(cmd->sense_phys_addr);
2794 io_request->SenseBufferLength = SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE;
2795
2796 cmd->scmd = scp;
2797 scp->SCp.ptr = (char *)cmd;
2798
2799 return 0;
2800}
2801
2802static union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *
2803megasas_get_request_descriptor(struct megasas_instance *instance, u16 index)
2804{
2805 u8 *p;
2806 struct fusion_context *fusion;
2807
2808 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
2809 p = fusion->req_frames_desc +
2810 sizeof(union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION) * index;
2811
2812 return (union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *)p;
2813}
2814
2815
2816/* megasas_prepate_secondRaid1_IO
2817 * It prepares the raid 1 second IO
2818 */
2819void megasas_prepare_secondRaid1_IO(struct megasas_instance *instance,
2820 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd,
2821 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *r1_cmd)
2822{
2823 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc, *req_desc2 = NULL;
2824 struct fusion_context *fusion;
2825 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
2826 req_desc = cmd->request_desc;
2827 /* copy the io request frame as well as 8 SGEs data for r1 command*/
2828 memcpy(r1_cmd->io_request, cmd->io_request,
2829 (sizeof(struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST)));
2830 memcpy(&r1_cmd->io_request->SGL, &cmd->io_request->SGL,
2831 (fusion->max_sge_in_main_msg * sizeof(union MPI2_SGE_IO_UNION)));
2832 /*sense buffer is different for r1 command*/
2833 r1_cmd->io_request->SenseBufferLowAddress =
2834 cpu_to_le32(r1_cmd->sense_phys_addr);
2835 r1_cmd->scmd = cmd->scmd;
2836 req_desc2 = megasas_get_request_descriptor(instance,
2837 (r1_cmd->index - 1));
2838 req_desc2->Words = 0;
2839 r1_cmd->request_desc = req_desc2;
2840 req_desc2->SCSIIO.SMID = cpu_to_le16(r1_cmd->index);
2841 req_desc2->SCSIIO.RequestFlags = req_desc->SCSIIO.RequestFlags;
2842 r1_cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.DevHandle = cmd->r1_alt_dev_handle;
2843 r1_cmd->io_request->DevHandle = cmd->r1_alt_dev_handle;
2844 r1_cmd->r1_alt_dev_handle = cmd->io_request->DevHandle;
2845 cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.smid.peer_smid =
2846 cpu_to_le16(r1_cmd->index);
2847 r1_cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.smid.peer_smid =
2848 cpu_to_le16(cmd->index);
2849 /*MSIxIndex of both commands request descriptors should be same*/
2850 r1_cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.MSIxIndex =
2851 cmd->request_desc->SCSIIO.MSIxIndex;
2852 /*span arm is different for r1 cmd*/
2853 r1_cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.span_arm =
2854 cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35.span_arm + 1;
2855}
2856
2857/**
2858 * megasas_build_and_issue_cmd_fusion -Main routine for building and
2859 * issuing non IOCTL cmd
2860 * @instance: Adapter soft state
2861 * @scmd: pointer to scsi cmd from OS
2862 */
2863static u32
2864megasas_build_and_issue_cmd_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
2865 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
2866{
2867 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd, *r1_cmd = NULL;
2868 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc;
2869 u32 index;
2870 struct fusion_context *fusion;
2871
2872 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
2873
2874 if ((megasas_cmd_type(scmd) == READ_WRITE_LDIO) &&
2875 instance->ldio_threshold &&
2876 (atomic_inc_return(&instance->ldio_outstanding) >
2877 instance->ldio_threshold)) {
2878 atomic_dec(&instance->ldio_outstanding);
2879 return SCSI_MLQUEUE_DEVICE_BUSY;
2880 }
2881
2882 if (atomic_inc_return(&instance->fw_outstanding) >
2883 instance->host->can_queue) {
2884 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
2885 return SCSI_MLQUEUE_HOST_BUSY;
2886 }
2887
2888 cmd = megasas_get_cmd_fusion(instance, scmd->request->tag);
2889
2890 if (!cmd) {
2891 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
2892 return SCSI_MLQUEUE_HOST_BUSY;
2893 }
2894
2895 index = cmd->index;
2896
2897 req_desc = megasas_get_request_descriptor(instance, index-1);
2898
2899 req_desc->Words = 0;
2900 cmd->request_desc = req_desc;
2901
2902 if (megasas_build_io_fusion(instance, scmd, cmd)) {
2903 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, cmd);
2904 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Error building command\n");
2905 cmd->request_desc = NULL;
2906 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
2907 return SCSI_MLQUEUE_HOST_BUSY;
2908 }
2909
2910 req_desc = cmd->request_desc;
2911 req_desc->SCSIIO.SMID = cpu_to_le16(index);
2912
2913 if (cmd->io_request->ChainOffset != 0 &&
2914 cmd->io_request->ChainOffset != 0xF)
2915 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "The chain offset value is not "
2916 "correct : %x\n", cmd->io_request->ChainOffset);
2917 /*
2918 * if it is raid 1/10 fp write capable.
2919 * try to get second command from pool and construct it.
2920 * From FW, it has confirmed that lba values of two PDs
2921 * corresponds to single R1/10 LD are always same
2922 *
2923 */
2924 /* driver side count always should be less than max_fw_cmds
2925 * to get new command
2926 */
2927 if (cmd->r1_alt_dev_handle != MR_DEVHANDLE_INVALID) {
2928 r1_cmd = megasas_get_cmd_fusion(instance,
2929 (scmd->request->tag + instance->max_fw_cmds));
2930 megasas_prepare_secondRaid1_IO(instance, cmd, r1_cmd);
2931 }
2932
2933
2934 /*
2935 * Issue the command to the FW
2936 */
2937
2938 megasas_fire_cmd_fusion(instance, req_desc);
2939
2940 if (r1_cmd)
2941 megasas_fire_cmd_fusion(instance, r1_cmd->request_desc);
2942
2943
2944 return 0;
2945}
2946
2947/**
2948 * megasas_complete_r1_command -
2949 * completes R1 FP write commands which has valid peer smid
2950 * @instance: Adapter soft state
2951 * @cmd_fusion: MPT command frame
2952 *
2953 */
2954static inline void
2955megasas_complete_r1_command(struct megasas_instance *instance,
2956 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd)
2957{
2958 u8 *sense, status, ex_status;
2959 u32 data_length;
2960 u16 peer_smid;
2961 struct fusion_context *fusion;
2962 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *r1_cmd = NULL;
2963 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd_local = NULL;
2964 struct RAID_CONTEXT_G35 *rctx_g35;
2965
2966 rctx_g35 = &cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35;
2967 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
2968 peer_smid = le16_to_cpu(rctx_g35->smid.peer_smid);
2969
2970 r1_cmd = fusion->cmd_list[peer_smid - 1];
2971 scmd_local = cmd->scmd;
2972 status = rctx_g35->status;
2973 ex_status = rctx_g35->ex_status;
2974 data_length = cmd->io_request->DataLength;
2975 sense = cmd->sense;
2976
2977 cmd->cmd_completed = true;
2978
2979 /* Check if peer command is completed or not*/
2980 if (r1_cmd->cmd_completed) {
2981 rctx_g35 = &r1_cmd->io_request->RaidContext.raid_context_g35;
2982 if (rctx_g35->status != MFI_STAT_OK) {
2983 status = rctx_g35->status;
2984 ex_status = rctx_g35->ex_status;
2985 data_length = r1_cmd->io_request->DataLength;
2986 sense = r1_cmd->sense;
2987 }
2988
2989 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, r1_cmd);
2990 map_cmd_status(fusion, scmd_local, status, ex_status,
2991 le32_to_cpu(data_length), sense);
2992 if (instance->ldio_threshold &&
2993 megasas_cmd_type(scmd_local) == READ_WRITE_LDIO)
2994 atomic_dec(&instance->ldio_outstanding);
2995 scmd_local->SCp.ptr = NULL;
2996 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, cmd);
2997 scsi_dma_unmap(scmd_local);
2998 scmd_local->scsi_done(scmd_local);
2999 }
3000}
3001
3002/**
3003 * complete_cmd_fusion - Completes command
3004 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3005 * Completes all commands that is in reply descriptor queue
3006 */
3007int
3008complete_cmd_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance, u32 MSIxIndex)
3009{
3010 union MPI2_REPLY_DESCRIPTORS_UNION *desc;
3011 struct MPI2_SCSI_IO_SUCCESS_REPLY_DESCRIPTOR *reply_desc;
3012 struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST *scsi_io_req;
3013 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3014 struct megasas_cmd *cmd_mfi;
3015 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion;
3016 u16 smid, num_completed;
3017 u8 reply_descript_type, *sense, status, extStatus;
3018 u32 device_id, data_length;
3019 union desc_value d_val;
3020 struct LD_LOAD_BALANCE_INFO *lbinfo;
3021 int threshold_reply_count = 0;
3022 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd_local = NULL;
3023 struct MR_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *mr_tm_req;
3024 struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *mpi_tm_req;
3025
3026 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3027
3028 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR)
3029 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3030
3031 desc = fusion->reply_frames_desc[MSIxIndex] +
3032 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex];
3033
3034 reply_desc = (struct MPI2_SCSI_IO_SUCCESS_REPLY_DESCRIPTOR *)desc;
3035
3036 d_val.word = desc->Words;
3037
3038 reply_descript_type = reply_desc->ReplyFlags &
3039 MPI2_RPY_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_MASK;
3040
3041 if (reply_descript_type == MPI2_RPY_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_UNUSED)
3042 return IRQ_NONE;
3043
3044 num_completed = 0;
3045
3046 while (d_val.u.low != cpu_to_le32(UINT_MAX) &&
3047 d_val.u.high != cpu_to_le32(UINT_MAX)) {
3048
3049 smid = le16_to_cpu(reply_desc->SMID);
3050 cmd_fusion = fusion->cmd_list[smid - 1];
3051 scsi_io_req = (struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST *)
3052 cmd_fusion->io_request;
3053
3054 scmd_local = cmd_fusion->scmd;
3055 status = scsi_io_req->RaidContext.raid_context.status;
3056 extStatus = scsi_io_req->RaidContext.raid_context.ex_status;
3057 sense = cmd_fusion->sense;
3058 data_length = scsi_io_req->DataLength;
3059
3060 switch (scsi_io_req->Function) {
3061 case MPI2_FUNCTION_SCSI_TASK_MGMT:
3062 mr_tm_req = (struct MR_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *)
3063 cmd_fusion->io_request;
3064 mpi_tm_req = (struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *)
3065 &mr_tm_req->TmRequest;
3066 dev_dbg(&instance->pdev->dev, "TM completion:"
3067 "type: 0x%x TaskMID: 0x%x\n",
3068 mpi_tm_req->TaskType, mpi_tm_req->TaskMID);
3069 complete(&cmd_fusion->done);
3070 break;
3071 case MPI2_FUNCTION_SCSI_IO_REQUEST: /*Fast Path IO.*/
3072 /* Update load balancing info */
3073 if (fusion->load_balance_info &&
3074 (cmd_fusion->scmd->SCp.Status &
3075 MEGASAS_LOAD_BALANCE_FLAG)) {
3076 device_id = MEGASAS_DEV_INDEX(scmd_local);
3077 lbinfo = &fusion->load_balance_info[device_id];
3078 atomic_dec(&lbinfo->scsi_pending_cmds[cmd_fusion->pd_r1_lb]);
3079 cmd_fusion->scmd->SCp.Status &= ~MEGASAS_LOAD_BALANCE_FLAG;
3080 }
3081 //Fall thru and complete IO
3082 case MEGASAS_MPI2_FUNCTION_LD_IO_REQUEST: /* LD-IO Path */
3083 atomic_dec(&instance->fw_outstanding);
3084 if (cmd_fusion->r1_alt_dev_handle == MR_DEVHANDLE_INVALID) {
3085 map_cmd_status(fusion, scmd_local, status,
3086 extStatus, le32_to_cpu(data_length),
3087 sense);
3088 if (instance->ldio_threshold &&
3089 (megasas_cmd_type(scmd_local) == READ_WRITE_LDIO))
3090 atomic_dec(&instance->ldio_outstanding);
3091 scmd_local->SCp.ptr = NULL;
3092 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, cmd_fusion);
3093 scsi_dma_unmap(scmd_local);
3094 scmd_local->scsi_done(scmd_local);
3095 } else /* Optimal VD - R1 FP command completion. */
3096 megasas_complete_r1_command(instance, cmd_fusion);
3097 break;
3098 case MEGASAS_MPI2_FUNCTION_PASSTHRU_IO_REQUEST: /*MFI command */
3099 cmd_mfi = instance->cmd_list[cmd_fusion->sync_cmd_idx];
3100 /* Poll mode. Dummy free.
3101 * In case of Interrupt mode, caller has reverse check.
3102 */
3103 if (cmd_mfi->flags & DRV_DCMD_POLLED_MODE) {
3104 cmd_mfi->flags &= ~DRV_DCMD_POLLED_MODE;
3105 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd_mfi);
3106 } else
3107 megasas_complete_cmd(instance, cmd_mfi, DID_OK);
3108 break;
3109 }
3110
3111 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex]++;
3112 if (fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex] >=
3113 fusion->reply_q_depth)
3114 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex] = 0;
3115
3116 desc->Words = cpu_to_le64(ULLONG_MAX);
3117 num_completed++;
3118 threshold_reply_count++;
3119
3120 /* Get the next reply descriptor */
3121 if (!fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex])
3122 desc = fusion->reply_frames_desc[MSIxIndex];
3123 else
3124 desc++;
3125
3126 reply_desc =
3127 (struct MPI2_SCSI_IO_SUCCESS_REPLY_DESCRIPTOR *)desc;
3128
3129 d_val.word = desc->Words;
3130
3131 reply_descript_type = reply_desc->ReplyFlags &
3132 MPI2_RPY_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_MASK;
3133
3134 if (reply_descript_type == MPI2_RPY_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_UNUSED)
3135 break;
3136 /*
3137 * Write to reply post host index register after completing threshold
3138 * number of reply counts and still there are more replies in reply queue
3139 * pending to be completed
3140 */
3141 if (threshold_reply_count >= THRESHOLD_REPLY_COUNT) {
3142 if (instance->msix_combined)
3143 writel(((MSIxIndex & 0x7) << 24) |
3144 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex],
3145 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[MSIxIndex/8]);
3146 else
3147 writel((MSIxIndex << 24) |
3148 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex],
3149 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[0]);
3150 threshold_reply_count = 0;
3151 }
3152 }
3153
3154 if (!num_completed)
3155 return IRQ_NONE;
3156
3157 wmb();
3158 if (instance->msix_combined)
3159 writel(((MSIxIndex & 0x7) << 24) |
3160 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex],
3161 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[MSIxIndex/8]);
3162 else
3163 writel((MSIxIndex << 24) |
3164 fusion->last_reply_idx[MSIxIndex],
3165 instance->reply_post_host_index_addr[0]);
3166 megasas_check_and_restore_queue_depth(instance);
3167 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3168}
3169
3170/**
3171 * megasas_sync_irqs - Synchronizes all IRQs owned by adapter
3172 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3173 */
3174void megasas_sync_irqs(unsigned long instance_addr)
3175{
3176 u32 count, i;
3177 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3178 (struct megasas_instance *)instance_addr;
3179
3180 count = instance->msix_vectors > 0 ? instance->msix_vectors : 1;
3181
3182 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
3183 synchronize_irq(pci_irq_vector(instance->pdev, i));
3184}
3185
3186/**
3187 * megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion - Completes command
3188 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3189 *
3190 * Tasklet to complete cmds
3191 */
3192void
3193megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion(unsigned long instance_addr)
3194{
3195 struct megasas_instance *instance =
3196 (struct megasas_instance *)instance_addr;
3197 unsigned long flags;
3198 u32 count, MSIxIndex;
3199
3200 count = instance->msix_vectors > 0 ? instance->msix_vectors : 1;
3201
3202 /* If we have already declared adapter dead, donot complete cmds */
3203 spin_lock_irqsave(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3204 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
3205 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3206 return;
3207 }
3208 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&instance->hba_lock, flags);
3209
3210 for (MSIxIndex = 0 ; MSIxIndex < count; MSIxIndex++)
3211 complete_cmd_fusion(instance, MSIxIndex);
3212}
3213
3214/**
3215 * megasas_isr_fusion - isr entry point
3216 */
3217irqreturn_t megasas_isr_fusion(int irq, void *devp)
3218{
3219 struct megasas_irq_context *irq_context = devp;
3220 struct megasas_instance *instance = irq_context->instance;
3221 u32 mfiStatus, fw_state, dma_state;
3222
3223 if (instance->mask_interrupts)
3224 return IRQ_NONE;
3225
3226 if (!instance->msix_vectors) {
3227 mfiStatus = instance->instancet->clear_intr(instance->reg_set);
3228 if (!mfiStatus)
3229 return IRQ_NONE;
3230 }
3231
3232 /* If we are resetting, bail */
3233 if (test_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET, &instance->reset_flags)) {
3234 instance->instancet->clear_intr(instance->reg_set);
3235 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3236 }
3237
3238 if (!complete_cmd_fusion(instance, irq_context->MSIxIndex)) {
3239 instance->instancet->clear_intr(instance->reg_set);
3240 /* If we didn't complete any commands, check for FW fault */
3241 fw_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(
3242 instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3243 dma_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg
3244 (instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_DMADONE;
3245 if (instance->crash_dump_drv_support &&
3246 instance->crash_dump_app_support) {
3247 /* Start collecting crash, if DMA bit is done */
3248 if ((fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) && dma_state)
3249 schedule_work(&instance->crash_init);
3250 else if (fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) {
3251 if (instance->unload == 0)
3252 schedule_work(&instance->work_init);
3253 }
3254 } else if (fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) {
3255 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "Iop2SysDoorbellInt"
3256 "for scsi%d\n", instance->host->host_no);
3257 if (instance->unload == 0)
3258 schedule_work(&instance->work_init);
3259 }
3260 }
3261
3262 return IRQ_HANDLED;
3263}
3264
3265/**
3266 * build_mpt_mfi_pass_thru - builds a cmd fo MFI Pass thru
3267 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3268 * mfi_cmd: megasas_cmd pointer
3269 *
3270 */
3271void
3272build_mpt_mfi_pass_thru(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3273 struct megasas_cmd *mfi_cmd)
3274{
3275 struct MPI25_IEEE_SGE_CHAIN64 *mpi25_ieee_chain;
3276 struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST *io_req;
3277 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd;
3278 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3279 struct megasas_header *frame_hdr = &mfi_cmd->frame->hdr;
3280
3281 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3282
3283 cmd = megasas_get_cmd_fusion(instance,
3284 instance->max_scsi_cmds + mfi_cmd->index);
3285
3286 /* Save the smid. To be used for returning the cmd */
3287 mfi_cmd->context.smid = cmd->index;
3288
3289 /*
3290 * For cmds where the flag is set, store the flag and check
3291 * on completion. For cmds with this flag, don't call
3292 * megasas_complete_cmd
3293 */
3294
3295 if (frame_hdr->flags & cpu_to_le16(MFI_FRAME_DONT_POST_IN_REPLY_QUEUE))
3296 mfi_cmd->flags |= DRV_DCMD_POLLED_MODE;
3297
3298 io_req = cmd->io_request;
3299
3300 if (instance->adapter_type >= INVADER_SERIES) {
3301 struct MPI25_IEEE_SGE_CHAIN64 *sgl_ptr_end =
3302 (struct MPI25_IEEE_SGE_CHAIN64 *)&io_req->SGL;
3303 sgl_ptr_end += fusion->max_sge_in_main_msg - 1;
3304 sgl_ptr_end->Flags = 0;
3305 }
3306
3307 mpi25_ieee_chain =
3308 (struct MPI25_IEEE_SGE_CHAIN64 *)&io_req->SGL.IeeeChain;
3309
3310 io_req->Function = MEGASAS_MPI2_FUNCTION_PASSTHRU_IO_REQUEST;
3311 io_req->SGLOffset0 = offsetof(struct MPI2_RAID_SCSI_IO_REQUEST,
3312 SGL) / 4;
3313 io_req->ChainOffset = fusion->chain_offset_mfi_pthru;
3314
3315 mpi25_ieee_chain->Address = cpu_to_le64(mfi_cmd->frame_phys_addr);
3316
3317 mpi25_ieee_chain->Flags = IEEE_SGE_FLAGS_CHAIN_ELEMENT |
3318 MPI2_IEEE_SGE_FLAGS_IOCPLBNTA_ADDR;
3319
3320 mpi25_ieee_chain->Length = cpu_to_le32(instance->mfi_frame_size);
3321}
3322
3323/**
3324 * build_mpt_cmd - Calls helper function to build a cmd MFI Pass thru cmd
3325 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3326 * @cmd: mfi cmd to build
3327 *
3328 */
3329union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *
3330build_mpt_cmd(struct megasas_instance *instance, struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
3331{
3332 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc = NULL;
3333 u16 index;
3334
3335 build_mpt_mfi_pass_thru(instance, cmd);
3336 index = cmd->context.smid;
3337
3338 req_desc = megasas_get_request_descriptor(instance, index - 1);
3339
3340 req_desc->Words = 0;
3341 req_desc->SCSIIO.RequestFlags = (MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_SCSI_IO <<
3342 MEGASAS_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_SHIFT);
3343
3344 req_desc->SCSIIO.SMID = cpu_to_le16(index);
3345
3346 return req_desc;
3347}
3348
3349/**
3350 * megasas_issue_dcmd_fusion - Issues a MFI Pass thru cmd
3351 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3352 * @cmd: mfi cmd pointer
3353 *
3354 */
3355void
3356megasas_issue_dcmd_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3357 struct megasas_cmd *cmd)
3358{
3359 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc;
3360
3361 req_desc = build_mpt_cmd(instance, cmd);
3362
3363 megasas_fire_cmd_fusion(instance, req_desc);
3364 return;
3365}

3367/**
3368 * megasas_release_fusion - Reverses the FW initialization
3369 * @instance: Adapter soft state
3370 */
3371void
3372megasas_release_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3373{
3374 megasas_free_cmds(instance);
3375 megasas_free_cmds_fusion(instance);
3376
3377 iounmap(instance->reg_set);
3378
3379 pci_release_selected_regions(instance->pdev, 1<<instance->bar);
3380}

3382/**
3383 * megasas_read_fw_status_reg_fusion - returns the current FW status value
3384 * @regs: MFI register set
3385 */
3386static u32
3387megasas_read_fw_status_reg_fusion(struct megasas_register_set __iomem *regs)
3388{
3389 return readl(&(regs)->outbound_scratch_pad);
3390}

3392/**
3393 * megasas_alloc_host_crash_buffer - Host buffers for Crash dump collection from Firmware
3394 * @instance: Controller's soft instance
3395 * return: Number of allocated host crash buffers
3396 */
3397static void
3398megasas_alloc_host_crash_buffer(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3399{
3400 unsigned int i;
3401
3402 for (i = 0; i < MAX_CRASH_DUMP_SIZE; i++) {
3403 instance->crash_buf[i] = vzalloc(CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE);
3404 if (!instance->crash_buf[i]) {
3405 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Firmware crash dump "
3406 "memory allocation failed at index %d\n", i);
3407 break;
3408 }
3409 }
3410 instance->drv_buf_alloc = i;
3411}
3412
3413/**
3414 * megasas_free_host_crash_buffer - Host buffers for Crash dump collection from Firmware
3415 * @instance: Controller's soft instance
3416 */
3417void
3418megasas_free_host_crash_buffer(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3419{
3420 unsigned int i;
3421 for (i = 0; i < instance->drv_buf_alloc; i++) {
3422 if (instance->crash_buf[i])
3423 vfree(instance->crash_buf[i]);
3424 }
3425 instance->drv_buf_index = 0;
3426 instance->drv_buf_alloc = 0;
3427 instance->fw_crash_state = UNAVAILABLE;
3428 instance->fw_crash_buffer_size = 0;
3429}
3430
3431/**
3432 * megasas_adp_reset_fusion - For controller reset
3433 * @regs: MFI register set
3434 */
3435static int
3436megasas_adp_reset_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3437 struct megasas_register_set __iomem *regs)
3438{
3439 u32 host_diag, abs_state, retry;
3440
3441 /* Now try to reset the chip */
3442 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_FLUSH_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3443 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_1ST_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3444 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_2ND_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3445 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_3RD_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3446 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_4TH_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3447 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_5TH_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3448 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_6TH_KEY_VALUE, &instance->reg_set->fusion_seq_offset);
3449
3450 /* Check that the diag write enable (DRWE) bit is on */
3451 host_diag = readl(&instance->reg_set->fusion_host_diag);
3452 retry = 0;
3453 while (!(host_diag & HOST_DIAG_WRITE_ENABLE)) {
3454 msleep(100);
3455 host_diag = readl(&instance->reg_set->fusion_host_diag);
3456 if (retry++ == 100) {
3457 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
3458 "Host diag unlock failed from %s %d\n",
3459 __func__, __LINE__);
3460 break;
3461 }
3462 }
3463 if (!(host_diag & HOST_DIAG_WRITE_ENABLE))
3464 return -1;
3465
3466 /* Send chip reset command */
3467 writel(host_diag | HOST_DIAG_RESET_ADAPTER,
3468 &instance->reg_set->fusion_host_diag);
3469 msleep(3000);
3470
3471 /* Make sure reset adapter bit is cleared */
3472 host_diag = readl(&instance->reg_set->fusion_host_diag);
3473 retry = 0;
3474 while (host_diag & HOST_DIAG_RESET_ADAPTER) {
3475 msleep(100);
3476 host_diag = readl(&instance->reg_set->fusion_host_diag);
3477 if (retry++ == 1000) {
3478 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
3479 "Diag reset adapter never cleared %s %d\n",
3480 __func__, __LINE__);
3481 break;
3482 }
3483 }
3484 if (host_diag & HOST_DIAG_RESET_ADAPTER)
3485 return -1;
3486
3487 abs_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set)
3488 & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3489 retry = 0;
3490
3491 while ((abs_state <= MFI_STATE_FW_INIT) && (retry++ < 1000)) {
3492 msleep(100);
3493 abs_state = instance->instancet->
3494 read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3495 }
3496 if (abs_state <= MFI_STATE_FW_INIT) {
3497 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
3498 "fw state < MFI_STATE_FW_INIT, state = 0x%x %s %d\n",
3499 abs_state, __func__, __LINE__);
3500 return -1;
3501 }
3502
3503 return 0;
3504}

3507 * megasas_check_reset_fusion - For controller reset check
3508 * @regs: MFI register set
3509 */
3510static int
3511megasas_check_reset_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3512 struct megasas_register_set __iomem *regs)
3513{
3514 return 0;
3515}
3516
3517/* This function waits for outstanding commands on fusion to complete */
3518int megasas_wait_for_outstanding_fusion(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3519 int reason, int *convert)
3520{
3521 int i, outstanding, retval = 0, hb_seconds_missed = 0;
3522 u32 fw_state;
3523
3524 for (i = 0; i < resetwaittime; i++) {
3525 /* Check if firmware is in fault state */
3526 fw_state = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(
3527 instance->reg_set) & MFI_STATE_MASK;
3528 if (fw_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT) {
3529 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "Found FW in FAULT state,"
3530 " will reset adapter scsi%d.\n",
3531 instance->host->host_no);
3532 megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion((unsigned long)instance);
3533 if (instance->requestorId && reason) {
3534 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "SR-IOV Found FW in FAULT"
3535 " state while polling during"
3536 " I/O timeout handling for %d\n",
3537 instance->host->host_no);
3538 *convert = 1;
3539 }
3540
3541 retval = 1;
3542 goto out;
3543 }
3544
3545 if (reason == MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR) {
3546 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
3547 "MFI IO is timed out, initiating OCR\n");
3548 megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion((unsigned long)instance);
3549 retval = 1;
3550 goto out;
3551 }
3552
3553 /* If SR-IOV VF mode & heartbeat timeout, don't wait */
3554 if (instance->requestorId && !reason) {
3555 retval = 1;
3556 goto out;
3557 }
3558
3559 /* If SR-IOV VF mode & I/O timeout, check for HB timeout */
3560 if (instance->requestorId && (reason == SCSIIO_TIMEOUT_OCR)) {
3561 if (instance->hb_host_mem->HB.fwCounter !=
3562 instance->hb_host_mem->HB.driverCounter) {
3563 instance->hb_host_mem->HB.driverCounter =
3564 instance->hb_host_mem->HB.fwCounter;
3565 hb_seconds_missed = 0;
3566 } else {
3567 hb_seconds_missed++;
3568 if (hb_seconds_missed ==
3569 (MEGASAS_SRIOV_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_VF/HZ)) {
3570 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "SR-IOV:"
3571 " Heartbeat never completed "
3572 " while polling during I/O "
3573 " timeout handling for "
3574 "scsi%d.\n",
3575 instance->host->host_no);
3576 *convert = 1;
3577 retval = 1;
3578 goto out;
3579 }
3580 }
3581 }
3582
3583 megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion((unsigned long)instance);
3584 outstanding = atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding);
3585 if (!outstanding)
3586 goto out;
3587
3588 if (!(i % MEGASAS_RESET_NOTICE_INTERVAL)) {
3589 dev_notice(&instance->pdev->dev, "[%2d]waiting for %d "
3590 "commands to complete for scsi%d\n", i,
3591 outstanding, instance->host->host_no);
3592 }
3593 msleep(1000);
3594 }
3595
3596 if (atomic_read(&instance->fw_outstanding)) {
3597 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "pending commands remain after waiting, "
3598 "will reset adapter scsi%d.\n",
3599 instance->host->host_no);
3600 *convert = 1;
3601 retval = 1;
3602 }
3603out:
3604 return retval;
3605}
3606
3607void megasas_reset_reply_desc(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3608{
3609 int i, j, count;
3610 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3611 union MPI2_REPLY_DESCRIPTORS_UNION *reply_desc;
3612
3613 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3614 count = instance->msix_vectors > 0 ? instance->msix_vectors : 1;
3615 for (i = 0 ; i < count ; i++) {
3616 fusion->last_reply_idx[i] = 0;
3617 reply_desc = fusion->reply_frames_desc[i];
3618 for (j = 0 ; j < fusion->reply_q_depth; j++, reply_desc++)
3619 reply_desc->Words = cpu_to_le64(ULLONG_MAX);
3620 }
3621}
3622
3623/*
3624 * megasas_refire_mgmt_cmd : Re-fire management commands
3625 * @instance: Controller's soft instance
3626*/
3627void megasas_refire_mgmt_cmd(struct megasas_instance *instance)
3628{
3629 int j;
3630 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion;
3631 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3632 struct megasas_cmd *cmd_mfi;
3633 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc;
3634 u16 smid;
3635 bool refire_cmd = 0;
3636
3637 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3638
3639 /* Re-fire management commands.
3640 * Do not traverse complet MPT frame pool. Start from max_scsi_cmds.
3641 */
3642 for (j = instance->max_scsi_cmds ; j < instance->max_fw_cmds; j++) {
3643 cmd_fusion = fusion->cmd_list[j];
3644 cmd_mfi = instance->cmd_list[cmd_fusion->sync_cmd_idx];
3645 smid = le16_to_cpu(cmd_mfi->context.smid);
3646
3647 if (!smid)
3648 continue;
3649
3650 /* Do not refire shutdown command */
3651 if (le32_to_cpu(cmd_mfi->frame->dcmd.opcode) ==
3652 MR_DCMD_CTRL_SHUTDOWN) {
3653 cmd_mfi->frame->dcmd.cmd_status = MFI_STAT_OK;
3654 megasas_complete_cmd(instance, cmd_mfi, DID_OK);
3655 continue;
3656 }
3657
3658 req_desc = megasas_get_request_descriptor
3659 (instance, smid - 1);
3660 refire_cmd = req_desc && ((cmd_mfi->frame->dcmd.opcode !=
3661 cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_LD_MAP_GET_INFO)) &&
3662 (cmd_mfi->frame->dcmd.opcode !=
3663 cpu_to_le32(MR_DCMD_SYSTEM_PD_MAP_GET_INFO)))
3664 && !(cmd_mfi->flags & DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE);
3665 if (refire_cmd)
3666 megasas_fire_cmd_fusion(instance, req_desc);
3667 else
3668 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd_mfi);
3669 }
3670}
3671
3672/*
3673 * megasas_track_scsiio : Track SCSI IOs outstanding to a SCSI device
3674 * @instance: per adapter struct
3675 * @channel: the channel assigned by the OS
3676 * @id: the id assigned by the OS
3677 *
3678 * Returns SUCCESS if no IOs pending to SCSI device, else return FAILED
3679 */
3680
3681static int megasas_track_scsiio(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3682 int id, int channel)
3683{
3684 int i, found = 0;
3685 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion;
3686 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3687 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3688
3689 for (i = 0 ; i < instance->max_scsi_cmds; i++) {
3690 cmd_fusion = fusion->cmd_list[i];
3691 if (cmd_fusion->scmd &&
3692 (cmd_fusion->scmd->device->id == id &&
3693 cmd_fusion->scmd->device->channel == channel)) {
3694 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
3695 "SCSI commands pending to target"
3696 "channel %d id %d \tSMID: 0x%x\n",
3697 channel, id, cmd_fusion->index);
3698 scsi_print_command(cmd_fusion->scmd);
3699 found = 1;
3700 break;
3701 }
3702 }
3703
3704 return found ? FAILED : SUCCESS;
3705}
3706
3707/**
3708 * megasas_tm_response_code - translation of device response code
3709 * @ioc: per adapter object
3710 * @mpi_reply: MPI reply returned by firmware
3711 *
3712 * Return nothing.
3713 */
3714static void
3715megasas_tm_response_code(struct megasas_instance *instance,
3716 struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REPLY *mpi_reply)
3717{
3718 char *desc;
3719
3720 switch (mpi_reply->ResponseCode) {
3721 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_TM_COMPLETE:
3722 desc = "task management request completed";
3723 break;
3724 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_INVALID_FRAME:
3725 desc = "invalid frame";
3726 break;
3727 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_TM_NOT_SUPPORTED:
3728 desc = "task management request not supported";
3729 break;
3730 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_TM_FAILED:
3731 desc = "task management request failed";
3732 break;
3733 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_TM_SUCCEEDED:
3734 desc = "task management request succeeded";
3735 break;
3736 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_TM_INVALID_LUN:
3737 desc = "invalid lun";
3738 break;
3739 case 0xA:
3740 desc = "overlapped tag attempted";
3741 break;
3742 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_RSP_IO_QUEUED_ON_IOC:
3743 desc = "task queued, however not sent to target";
3744 break;
3745 default:
3746 desc = "unknown";
3747 break;
3748 }
3749 dev_dbg(&instance->pdev->dev, "response_code(%01x): %s\n",
3750 mpi_reply->ResponseCode, desc);
3751 dev_dbg(&instance->pdev->dev,
3752 "TerminationCount/DevHandle/Function/TaskType/IOCStat/IOCLoginfo"
3753 " 0x%x/0x%x/0x%x/0x%x/0x%x/0x%x\n",
3754 mpi_reply->TerminationCount, mpi_reply->DevHandle,
3755 mpi_reply->Function, mpi_reply->TaskType,
3756 mpi_reply->IOCStatus, mpi_reply->IOCLogInfo);
3757}
3758
3759/**
3760 * megasas_issue_tm - main routine for sending tm requests
3761 * @instance: per adapter struct
3762 * @device_handle: device handle
3763 * @channel: the channel assigned by the OS
3764 * @id: the id assigned by the OS
3765 * @type: MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE__XXX (defined in megaraid_sas_fusion.c)
3766 * @smid_task: smid assigned to the task
3767 * @m_type: TM_MUTEX_ON or TM_MUTEX_OFF
3768 * Context: user
3769 *
3770 * MegaRaid use MPT interface for Task Magement request.
3771 * A generic API for sending task management requests to firmware.
3772 *
3773 * Return SUCCESS or FAILED.
3774 */
3775static int
3776megasas_issue_tm(struct megasas_instance *instance, u16 device_handle,
3777 uint channel, uint id, u16 smid_task, u8 type)
3778{
3779 struct MR_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *mr_request;
3780 struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *mpi_request;
3781 unsigned long timeleft;
3782 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion;
3783 struct megasas_cmd *cmd_mfi;
3784 union MEGASAS_REQUEST_DESCRIPTOR_UNION *req_desc;
3785 struct fusion_context *fusion = NULL;
3786 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *scsi_lookup;
3787 int rc;
3788 struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REPLY *mpi_reply;
3789
3790 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3791
3792 cmd_mfi = megasas_get_cmd(instance);
3793
3794 if (!cmd_mfi) {
3795 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed from %s %d\n",
3796 __func__, __LINE__);
3797 return -ENOMEM;
3798 }
3799
3800 cmd_fusion = megasas_get_cmd_fusion(instance,
3801 instance->max_scsi_cmds + cmd_mfi->index);
3802
3803 /* Save the smid. To be used for returning the cmd */
3804 cmd_mfi->context.smid = cmd_fusion->index;
3805
3806 req_desc = megasas_get_request_descriptor(instance,
3807 (cmd_fusion->index - 1));
3808
3809 cmd_fusion->request_desc = req_desc;
3810 req_desc->Words = 0;
3811
3812 mr_request = (struct MR_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *) cmd_fusion->io_request;
3813 memset(mr_request, 0, sizeof(struct MR_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST));
3814 mpi_request = (struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REQUEST *) &mr_request->TmRequest;
3815 mpi_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_SCSI_TASK_MGMT;
3816 mpi_request->DevHandle = cpu_to_le16(device_handle);
3817 mpi_request->TaskType = type;
3818 mpi_request->TaskMID = cpu_to_le16(smid_task);
3819 mpi_request->LUN[1] = 0;
3820
3821
3822 req_desc = cmd_fusion->request_desc;
3823 req_desc->HighPriority.SMID = cpu_to_le16(cmd_fusion->index);
3824 req_desc->HighPriority.RequestFlags =
3825 (MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_HIGH_PRIORITY <<
3826 MEGASAS_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_TYPE_SHIFT);
3827 req_desc->HighPriority.MSIxIndex = 0;
3828 req_desc->HighPriority.LMID = 0;
3829 req_desc->HighPriority.Reserved1 = 0;
3830
3831 if (channel < MEGASAS_MAX_PD_CHANNELS)
3832 mr_request->tmReqFlags.isTMForPD = 1;
3833 else
3834 mr_request->tmReqFlags.isTMForLD = 1;
3835
3836 init_completion(&cmd_fusion->done);
3837 megasas_fire_cmd_fusion(instance, req_desc);
3838
3839 timeleft = wait_for_completion_timeout(&cmd_fusion->done, 50 * HZ);
3840
3841 if (!timeleft) {
3842 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev,
3843 "task mgmt type 0x%x timed out\n", type);
3844 cmd_mfi->flags |= DRV_DCMD_SKIP_REFIRE;
3845 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
3846 rc = megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host, MFI_IO_TIMEOUT_OCR);
3847 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
3848 return rc;
3849 }
3850
3851 mpi_reply = (struct MPI2_SCSI_TASK_MANAGE_REPLY *) &mr_request->TMReply;
3852 megasas_tm_response_code(instance, mpi_reply);
3853
3854 megasas_return_cmd(instance, cmd_mfi);
3855 rc = SUCCESS;
3856 switch (type) {
3857 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_ABORT_TASK:
3858 scsi_lookup = fusion->cmd_list[smid_task - 1];
3859
3860 if (scsi_lookup->scmd == NULL)
3861 break;
3862 else {
3863 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3864 megasas_sync_irqs((unsigned long)instance);
3865 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
3866 if (scsi_lookup->scmd == NULL)
3867 break;
3868 }
3869 rc = FAILED;
3870 break;
3871
3872 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_TARGET_RESET:
3873 if ((channel == 0xFFFFFFFF) && (id == 0xFFFFFFFF))
3874 break;
3875 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
3876 megasas_sync_irqs((unsigned long)instance);
3877 rc = megasas_track_scsiio(instance, id, channel);
3878 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
3879
3880 break;
3881 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_ABRT_TASK_SET:
3882 case MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_QUERY_TASK:
3883 break;
3884 default:
3885 rc = FAILED;
3886 break;
3887 }
3888
3889 return rc;
3890
3891}
3892
3893/*
3894 * megasas_fusion_smid_lookup : Look for fusion command correpspodning to SCSI
3895 * @instance: per adapter struct
3896 *
3897 * Return Non Zero index, if SMID found in outstanding commands
3898 */
3899static u16 megasas_fusion_smid_lookup(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
3900{
3901 int i, ret = 0;
3902 struct megasas_instance *instance;
3903 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion;
3904 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3905
3906 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
3907
3908 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3909
3910 for (i = 0; i < instance->max_scsi_cmds; i++) {
3911 cmd_fusion = fusion->cmd_list[i];
3912 if (cmd_fusion->scmd && (cmd_fusion->scmd == scmd)) {
3913 scmd_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd, "Abort request is for"
3914 " SMID: %d\n", cmd_fusion->index);
3915 ret = cmd_fusion->index;
3916 break;
3917 }
3918 }
3919
3920 return ret;
3921}
3922
3923/*
3924* megasas_get_tm_devhandle - Get devhandle for TM request
3925* @sdev- OS provided scsi device
3926*
3927* Returns- devhandle/targetID of SCSI device
3928*/
3929static u16 megasas_get_tm_devhandle(struct scsi_device *sdev)
3930{
3931 u16 pd_index = 0;
3932 u32 device_id;
3933 struct megasas_instance *instance;
3934 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3935 struct MR_PD_CFG_SEQ_NUM_SYNC *pd_sync;
3936 u16 devhandle = (u16)ULONG_MAX;
3937
3938 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)sdev->host->hostdata;
3939 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3940
3941 if (!MEGASAS_IS_LOGICAL(sdev)) {
3942 if (instance->use_seqnum_jbod_fp) {
3943 pd_index = (sdev->channel * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL)
3944 + sdev->id;
3945 pd_sync = (void *)fusion->pd_seq_sync
3946 [(instance->pd_seq_map_id - 1) & 1];
3947 devhandle = pd_sync->seq[pd_index].devHandle;
3948 } else
3949 sdev_printk(KERN_ERR, sdev, "Firmware expose tmCapable"
3950 " without JBOD MAP support from %s %d\n", __func__, __LINE__);
3951 } else {
3952 device_id = ((sdev->channel % 2) * MEGASAS_MAX_DEV_PER_CHANNEL)
3953 + sdev->id;
3954 devhandle = device_id;
3955 }
3956
3957 return devhandle;
3958}
3959
3960/*
3961 * megasas_task_abort_fusion : SCSI task abort function for fusion adapters
3962 * @scmd : pointer to scsi command object
3963 *
3964 * Return SUCCESS, if command aborted else FAILED
3965 */
3966
3967int megasas_task_abort_fusion(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
3968{
3969 struct megasas_instance *instance;
3970 u16 smid, devhandle;
3971 struct fusion_context *fusion;
3972 int ret;
3973 struct MR_PRIV_DEVICE *mr_device_priv_data;
3974 mr_device_priv_data = scmd->device->hostdata;
3975
3976
3977 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
3978 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
3979
3980 scmd_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd, "task abort called for scmd(%p)\n", scmd);
3981 scsi_print_command(scmd);
3982
3983 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
3984 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Controller is not OPERATIONAL,"
3985 "SCSI host:%d\n", instance->host->host_no);
3986 ret = FAILED;
3987 return ret;
3988 }
3989
3990 if (!mr_device_priv_data) {
3991 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device, "device been deleted! "
3992 "scmd(%p)\n", scmd);
3993 scmd->result = DID_NO_CONNECT << 16;
3994 ret = SUCCESS;
3995 goto out;
3996 }
3997
3998
3999 if (!mr_device_priv_data->is_tm_capable) {
4000 ret = FAILED;
4001 goto out;
4002 }
4003
4004 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4005
4006 smid = megasas_fusion_smid_lookup(scmd);
4007
4008 if (!smid) {
4009 ret = SUCCESS;
4010 scmd_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd, "Command for which abort is"
4011 " issued is not found in oustanding commands\n");
4012 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4013 goto out;
4014 }
4015
4016 devhandle = megasas_get_tm_devhandle(scmd->device);
4017
4018 if (devhandle == (u16)ULONG_MAX) {
4019 ret = SUCCESS;
4020 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device,
4021 "task abort issued for invalid devhandle\n");
4022 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4023 goto out;
4024 }
4025 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device,
4026 "attempting task abort! scmd(%p) tm_dev_handle 0x%x\n",
4027 scmd, devhandle);
4028
4029 mr_device_priv_data->tm_busy = 1;
4030 ret = megasas_issue_tm(instance, devhandle,
4031 scmd->device->channel, scmd->device->id, smid,
4032 MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_ABORT_TASK);
4033 mr_device_priv_data->tm_busy = 0;
4034
4035 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4036out:
4037 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device, "task abort: %s scmd(%p)\n",
4038 ((ret == SUCCESS) ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"), scmd);
4039
4040 return ret;
4041}
4042
4043/*
4044 * megasas_reset_target_fusion : target reset function for fusion adapters
4045 * scmd: SCSI command pointer
4046 *
4047 * Returns SUCCESS if all commands associated with target aborted else FAILED
4048 */
4049
4050int megasas_reset_target_fusion(struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
4051{
4052
4053 struct megasas_instance *instance;
4054 int ret = FAILED;
4055 u16 devhandle;
4056 struct fusion_context *fusion;
4057 struct MR_PRIV_DEVICE *mr_device_priv_data;
4058 mr_device_priv_data = scmd->device->hostdata;
4059
4060 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)scmd->device->host->hostdata;
4061 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4062
4063 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device,
4064 "target reset called for scmd(%p)\n", scmd);
4065
4066 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
4067 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Controller is not OPERATIONAL,"
4068 "SCSI host:%d\n", instance->host->host_no);
4069 ret = FAILED;
4070 return ret;
4071 }
4072
4073 if (!mr_device_priv_data) {
4074 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device, "device been deleted! "
4075 "scmd(%p)\n", scmd);
4076 scmd->result = DID_NO_CONNECT << 16;
4077 ret = SUCCESS;
4078 goto out;
4079 }
4080
4081
4082 if (!mr_device_priv_data->is_tm_capable) {
4083 ret = FAILED;
4084 goto out;
4085 }
4086
4087 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4088 devhandle = megasas_get_tm_devhandle(scmd->device);
4089
4090 if (devhandle == (u16)ULONG_MAX) {
4091 ret = SUCCESS;
4092 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device,
4093 "target reset issued for invalid devhandle\n");
4094 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4095 goto out;
4096 }
4097
4098 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO, scmd->device,
4099 "attempting target reset! scmd(%p) tm_dev_handle 0x%x\n",
4100 scmd, devhandle);
4101 mr_device_priv_data->tm_busy = 1;
4102 ret = megasas_issue_tm(instance, devhandle,
4103 scmd->device->channel, scmd->device->id, 0,
4104 MPI2_SCSITASKMGMT_TASKTYPE_TARGET_RESET);
4105 mr_device_priv_data->tm_busy = 0;
4106 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4107out:
4108 scmd_printk(KERN_NOTICE, scmd, "megasas: target reset %s!!\n",
4109 (ret == SUCCESS) ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED");
4110
4111 return ret;
4112}
4113
4114/*SRIOV get other instance in cluster if any*/
4115struct megasas_instance *megasas_get_peer_instance(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4116{
4117 int i;
4118
4119 for (i = 0; i < MAX_MGMT_ADAPTERS; i++) {
4120 if (megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i] &&
4121 (megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i] != instance) &&
4122 megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i]->requestorId &&
4123 megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i]->peerIsPresent &&
4124 (memcmp((megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i]->clusterId),
4125 instance->clusterId, MEGASAS_CLUSTER_ID_SIZE) == 0))
4126 return megasas_mgmt_info.instance[i];
4127 }
4128 return NULL;
4129}
4130
4131/* Check for a second path that is currently UP */
4132int megasas_check_mpio_paths(struct megasas_instance *instance,
4133 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
4134{
4135 struct megasas_instance *peer_instance = NULL;
4136 int retval = (DID_REQUEUE << 16);
4137
4138 if (instance->peerIsPresent) {
4139 peer_instance = megasas_get_peer_instance(instance);
4140 if ((peer_instance) &&
4141 (atomic_read(&peer_instance->adprecovery) ==
4142 MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL))
4143 retval = (DID_NO_CONNECT << 16);
4144 }
4145 return retval;
4146}
4147
4148/* Core fusion reset function */
4149int megasas_reset_fusion(struct Scsi_Host *shost, int reason)
4150{
4151 int retval = SUCCESS, i, j, convert = 0;
4152 struct megasas_instance *instance;
4153 struct megasas_cmd_fusion *cmd_fusion, *r1_cmd;
4154 struct fusion_context *fusion;
4155 u32 abs_state, status_reg, reset_adapter;
4156 u32 io_timeout_in_crash_mode = 0;
4157 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd_local = NULL;
4158 struct scsi_device *sdev;
4159
4160 instance = (struct megasas_instance *)shost->hostdata;
4161 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4162
4163 mutex_lock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4164
4165 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HW_CRITICAL_ERROR) {
4166 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "Hardware critical error, "
4167 "returning FAILED for scsi%d.\n",
4168 instance->host->host_no);
4169 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4170 return FAILED;
4171 }
4172 status_reg = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set);
4173 abs_state = status_reg & MFI_STATE_MASK;
4174
4175 /* IO timeout detected, forcibly put FW in FAULT state */
4176 if (abs_state != MFI_STATE_FAULT && instance->crash_dump_buf &&
4177 instance->crash_dump_app_support && reason) {
4178 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "IO/DCMD timeout is detected, "
4179 "forcibly FAULT Firmware\n");
4180 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_INFAULT);
4181 status_reg = readl(&instance->reg_set->doorbell);
4182 writel(status_reg | MFI_STATE_FORCE_OCR,
4183 &instance->reg_set->doorbell);
4184 readl(&instance->reg_set->doorbell);
4185 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4186 do {
4187 ssleep(3);
4188 io_timeout_in_crash_mode++;
4189 dev_dbg(&instance->pdev->dev, "waiting for [%d] "
4190 "seconds for crash dump collection and OCR "
4191 "to be done\n", (io_timeout_in_crash_mode * 3));
4192 } while ((atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) != MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) &&
4193 (io_timeout_in_crash_mode < 80));
4194
4195 if (atomic_read(&instance->adprecovery) == MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL) {
4196 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "OCR done for IO "
4197 "timeout case\n");
4198 retval = SUCCESS;
4199 } else {
4200 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Controller is not "
4201 "operational after 240 seconds wait for IO "
4202 "timeout case in FW crash dump mode\n do "
4203 "OCR/kill adapter\n");
4204 retval = megasas_reset_fusion(shost, 0);
4205 }
4206 return retval;
4207 }
4208
4209 if (instance->requestorId && !instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del)
4210 del_timer_sync(&instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer);
4211 set_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET, &instance->reset_flags);
4212 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_POLLING);
4213 instance->instancet->disable_intr(instance);
4214 megasas_sync_irqs((unsigned long)instance);
4215
4216 /* First try waiting for commands to complete */
4217 if (megasas_wait_for_outstanding_fusion(instance, reason,
4218 &convert)) {
4219 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_ADPRESET_SM_INFAULT);
4220 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "resetting fusion "
4221 "adapter scsi%d.\n", instance->host->host_no);
4222 if (convert)
4223 reason = 0;
4224
4225 if (megasas_dbg_lvl & OCR_LOGS)
4226 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "\nPending SCSI commands:\n");
4227
4228 /* Now return commands back to the OS */
4229 for (i = 0 ; i < instance->max_scsi_cmds; i++) {
4230 cmd_fusion = fusion->cmd_list[i];
4231 /*check for extra commands issued by driver*/
4232 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
4233 r1_cmd = fusion->cmd_list[i + instance->max_fw_cmds];
4234 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, r1_cmd);
4235 }
4236 scmd_local = cmd_fusion->scmd;
4237 if (cmd_fusion->scmd) {
4238 if (megasas_dbg_lvl & OCR_LOGS) {
4239 sdev_printk(KERN_INFO,
4240 cmd_fusion->scmd->device, "SMID: 0x%x\n",
4241 cmd_fusion->index);
4242 scsi_print_command(cmd_fusion->scmd);
4243 }
4244
4245 scmd_local->result =
4246 megasas_check_mpio_paths(instance,
4247 scmd_local);
4248 if (instance->ldio_threshold &&
4249 megasas_cmd_type(scmd_local) == READ_WRITE_LDIO)
4250 atomic_dec(&instance->ldio_outstanding);
4251 megasas_return_cmd_fusion(instance, cmd_fusion);
4252 scsi_dma_unmap(scmd_local);
4253 scmd_local->scsi_done(scmd_local);
4254 }
4255 }
4256
4257 atomic_set(&instance->fw_outstanding, 0);
4258
4259 status_reg = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(
4260 instance->reg_set);
4261 abs_state = status_reg & MFI_STATE_MASK;
4262 reset_adapter = status_reg & MFI_RESET_ADAPTER;
4263 if (instance->disableOnlineCtrlReset ||
4264 (abs_state == MFI_STATE_FAULT && !reset_adapter)) {
4265 /* Reset not supported, kill adapter */
4266 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "Reset not supported"
4267 ", killing adapter scsi%d.\n",
4268 instance->host->host_no);
4269 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4270 instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del = 1;
4271 retval = FAILED;
4272 goto out;
4273 }
4274
4275 /* Let SR-IOV VF & PF sync up if there was a HB failure */
4276 if (instance->requestorId && !reason) {
4277 msleep(MEGASAS_OCR_SETTLE_TIME_VF);
4278 goto transition_to_ready;
4279 }
4280
4281 /* Now try to reset the chip */
4282 for (i = 0; i < MEGASAS_FUSION_MAX_RESET_TRIES; i++) {
4283
4284 if (instance->instancet->adp_reset
4285 (instance, instance->reg_set))
4286 continue;
4287transition_to_ready:
4288 /* Wait for FW to become ready */
4289 if (megasas_transition_to_ready(instance, 1)) {
4290 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
4291 "Failed to transition controller to ready for "
4292 "scsi%d.\n", instance->host->host_no);
4293 if (instance->requestorId && !reason)
4294 goto fail_kill_adapter;
4295 else
4296 continue;
4297 }
4298 megasas_reset_reply_desc(instance);
4299 megasas_fusion_update_can_queue(instance, OCR_CONTEXT);
4300
4301 if (megasas_ioc_init_fusion(instance)) {
4302 if (instance->requestorId && !reason)
4303 goto fail_kill_adapter;
4304 else
4305 continue;
4306 }
4307
4308 megasas_refire_mgmt_cmd(instance);
4309
4310 if (megasas_get_ctrl_info(instance)) {
4311 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev,
4312 "Failed from %s %d\n",
4313 __func__, __LINE__);
4314 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4315 retval = FAILED;
4316 goto out;
4317 }
4318 /* Reset load balance info */
4319 if (fusion->load_balance_info)
4320 memset(fusion->load_balance_info, 0,
4321 (sizeof(struct LD_LOAD_BALANCE_INFO) *
4322 MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT));
4323
4324 if (!megasas_get_map_info(instance))
4325 megasas_sync_map_info(instance);
4326
4327 megasas_setup_jbod_map(instance);
4328
4329 shost_for_each_device(sdev, shost)
4330 megasas_set_dynamic_target_properties(sdev);
4331
4332 /* reset stream detection array */
4333 if (instance->adapter_type == VENTURA_SERIES) {
4334 for (j = 0; j < MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT; ++j) {
4335 memset(fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[j],
4336 0, sizeof(struct LD_STREAM_DETECT));
4337 fusion->stream_detect_by_ld[j]->mru_bit_map
4338 = MR_STREAM_BITMAP;
4339 }
4340 }
4341
4342 clear_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET,
4343 &instance->reset_flags);
4344 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
4345 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL);
4346
4347 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Interrupts are enabled and"
4348 " controller is OPERATIONAL for scsi:%d\n",
4349 instance->host->host_no);
4350
4351 /* Restart SR-IOV heartbeat */
4352 if (instance->requestorId) {
4353 if (!megasas_sriov_start_heartbeat(instance, 0))
4354 megasas_start_timer(instance,
4355 &instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer,
4356 megasas_sriov_heartbeat_handler,
4357 MEGASAS_SRIOV_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_VF);
4358 else
4359 instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del = 1;
4360 }
4361
4362 if (instance->crash_dump_drv_support &&
4363 instance->crash_dump_app_support)
4364 megasas_set_crash_dump_params(instance,
4365 MR_CRASH_BUF_TURN_ON);
4366 else
4367 megasas_set_crash_dump_params(instance,
4368 MR_CRASH_BUF_TURN_OFF);
4369
4370 retval = SUCCESS;
4371
4372 /* Adapter reset completed successfully */
4373 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev,
4374 "Reset successful for scsi%d.\n",
4375 instance->host->host_no);
4376
4377 goto out;
4378 }
4379fail_kill_adapter:
4380 /* Reset failed, kill the adapter */
4381 dev_warn(&instance->pdev->dev, "Reset failed, killing "
4382 "adapter scsi%d.\n", instance->host->host_no);
4383 megaraid_sas_kill_hba(instance);
4384 instance->skip_heartbeat_timer_del = 1;
4385 retval = FAILED;
4386 } else {
4387 /* For VF: Restart HB timer if we didn't OCR */
4388 if (instance->requestorId) {
4389 megasas_start_timer(instance,
4390 &instance->sriov_heartbeat_timer,
4391 megasas_sriov_heartbeat_handler,
4392 MEGASAS_SRIOV_HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL_VF);
4393 }
4394 clear_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET, &instance->reset_flags);
4395 instance->instancet->enable_intr(instance);
4396 atomic_set(&instance->adprecovery, MEGASAS_HBA_OPERATIONAL);
4397 }
4398out:
4399 clear_bit(MEGASAS_FUSION_IN_RESET, &instance->reset_flags);
4400 mutex_unlock(&instance->reset_mutex);
4401 return retval;
4402}
4403
4404/* Fusion Crash dump collection work queue */
4405void megasas_fusion_crash_dump_wq(struct work_struct *work)
4406{
4407 struct megasas_instance *instance =
4408 container_of(work, struct megasas_instance, crash_init);
4409 u32 status_reg;
4410 u8 partial_copy = 0;
4411
4412
4413 status_reg = instance->instancet->read_fw_status_reg(instance->reg_set);
4414
4415 /*
4416 * Allocate host crash buffers to copy data from 1 MB DMA crash buffer
4417 * to host crash buffers
4418 */
4419 if (instance->drv_buf_index == 0) {
4420 /* Buffer is already allocated for old Crash dump.
4421 * Do OCR and do not wait for crash dump collection
4422 */
4423 if (instance->drv_buf_alloc) {
4424 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "earlier crash dump is "
4425 "not yet copied by application, ignoring this "
4426 "crash dump and initiating OCR\n");
4427 status_reg |= MFI_STATE_CRASH_DUMP_DONE;
4428 writel(status_reg,
4429 &instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4430 readl(&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4431 return;
4432 }
4433 megasas_alloc_host_crash_buffer(instance);
4434 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Number of host crash buffers "
4435 "allocated: %d\n", instance->drv_buf_alloc);
4436 }
4437
4438 /*
4439 * Driver has allocated max buffers, which can be allocated
4440 * and FW has more crash dump data, then driver will
4441 * ignore the data.
4442 */
4443 if (instance->drv_buf_index >= (instance->drv_buf_alloc)) {
4444 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Driver is done copying "
4445 "the buffer: %d\n", instance->drv_buf_alloc);
4446 status_reg |= MFI_STATE_CRASH_DUMP_DONE;
4447 partial_copy = 1;
4448 } else {
4449 memcpy(instance->crash_buf[instance->drv_buf_index],
4450 instance->crash_dump_buf, CRASH_DMA_BUF_SIZE);
4451 instance->drv_buf_index++;
4452 status_reg &= ~MFI_STATE_DMADONE;
4453 }
4454
4455 if (status_reg & MFI_STATE_CRASH_DUMP_DONE) {
4456 dev_info(&instance->pdev->dev, "Crash Dump is available,number "
4457 "of copied buffers: %d\n", instance->drv_buf_index);
4458 instance->fw_crash_buffer_size = instance->drv_buf_index;
4459 instance->fw_crash_state = AVAILABLE;
4460 instance->drv_buf_index = 0;
4461 writel(status_reg, &instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4462 readl(&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4463 if (!partial_copy)
4464 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host, 0);
4465 } else {
4466 writel(status_reg, &instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4467 readl(&instance->reg_set->outbound_scratch_pad);
4468 }
4469}
4470
4471
4472/* Fusion OCR work queue */
4473void megasas_fusion_ocr_wq(struct work_struct *work)
4474{
4475 struct megasas_instance *instance =
4476 container_of(work, struct megasas_instance, work_init);
4477
4478 megasas_reset_fusion(instance->host, 0);
4479}
4480
4481/* Allocate fusion context */
4482int
4483megasas_alloc_fusion_context(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4484{
4485 struct fusion_context *fusion;
4486
4487 instance->ctrl_context_pages = get_order(sizeof(struct fusion_context));
4488 instance->ctrl_context = (void *)__get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_ZERO,
4489 instance->ctrl_context_pages);
4490 if (!instance->ctrl_context) {
4491 /* fall back to using vmalloc for fusion_context */
4492 instance->ctrl_context = vzalloc(sizeof(struct fusion_context));
4493 if (!instance->ctrl_context) {
4494 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed from %s %d\n", __func__, __LINE__);
4495 return -ENOMEM;
4496 }
4497 }
4498
4499 fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4500
4501 fusion->load_balance_info_pages = get_order(MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT *
4502 sizeof(struct LD_LOAD_BALANCE_INFO));
4503 fusion->load_balance_info =
4504 (struct LD_LOAD_BALANCE_INFO *)__get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_ZERO,
4505 fusion->load_balance_info_pages);
4506 if (!fusion->load_balance_info) {
4507 fusion->load_balance_info = vzalloc(MAX_LOGICAL_DRIVES_EXT *
4508 sizeof(struct LD_LOAD_BALANCE_INFO));
4509 if (!fusion->load_balance_info)
4510 dev_err(&instance->pdev->dev, "Failed to allocate load_balance_info, "
4511 "continuing without Load Balance support\n");
4512 }
4513
4514 return 0;
4515}
4516
4517void
4518megasas_free_fusion_context(struct megasas_instance *instance)
4519{
4520 struct fusion_context *fusion = instance->ctrl_context;
4521
4522 if (fusion) {
4523 if (fusion->load_balance_info) {
4524 if (is_vmalloc_addr(fusion->load_balance_info))
4525 vfree(fusion->load_balance_info);
4526 else
4527 free_pages((ulong)fusion->load_balance_info,
4528 fusion->load_balance_info_pages);
4529 }
4530
4531 if (is_vmalloc_addr(fusion))
4532 vfree(fusion);
4533 else
4534 free_pages((ulong)fusion,
4535 instance->ctrl_context_pages);
4536 }
4537}
4538
4539struct megasas_instance_template megasas_instance_template_fusion = {
4540 .enable_intr = megasas_enable_intr_fusion,
4541 .disable_intr = megasas_disable_intr_fusion,
4542 .clear_intr = megasas_clear_intr_fusion,
4543 .read_fw_status_reg = megasas_read_fw_status_reg_fusion,
4544 .adp_reset = megasas_adp_reset_fusion,
4545 .check_reset = megasas_check_reset_fusion,
4546 .service_isr = megasas_isr_fusion,
4547 .tasklet = megasas_complete_cmd_dpc_fusion,
4548 .init_adapter = megasas_init_adapter_fusion,
4549 .build_and_issue_cmd = megasas_build_and_issue_cmd_fusion,
4550 .issue_dcmd = megasas_issue_dcmd_fusion,
4551};
